Detailed Description

Button capable of swallowing mouse move events for continous tracking.

A button with up to six images for its displayable states. The button has three states: default, disabled, and highlighted. These states can also have an alternate version that is displayed when the user right-clicks the widget.

Constructor & Destructor Documentation

DzMouseButton::DzMouseButton ( QWidget *  parent,
const QString &  name,
bool  isDragButton = false 
)
Parameters:
parent The parent widget of the button.
name The button's name.
isDragButton If true, this enables the special mouse capture abilities of this button. When the button is pressed, the mouse cursor is hidden, and all subsequent movement of the mouse is added into the drag point.

const QString &  name,
const QPixmap &  icon,
bool  isDragButton = false

This is an overloaded member function, provided for convenience. It differs from the above function only in what argument(s) it accepts.

Parameters:
parent The parent widget of the button.
name The button's name.
icon This single Icon will become the default icon of the button, and is further processed to create the disabled, and highlighted icons.
isDragButton If true, this enables the special mouse capture abilities of this button. When the button is pressed, the mouse cursor is hidden, and all subsequent movement of the mouse is added into the drag point.

Create a button with the given images.

Parameters:

name The button's name.

hilightPix The Icon that is displayed in the button's highlighted state.

DzMouseButton::dragged ( const QPoint &  pnt  )  [signal]

Emitted when the mouse is dragged while this button is pressed. Passes the button space coordinates that the cursor has.

Set the alternate images that can be drawn on this button.

Parameters:
defaultPix The image that is drawn if the button is enabled
disablePix The image that is drawn if the button is disabled
hilightPix The image that is drawn if the mouse is hovering over the button and the button is enabled.
